original: Egerström, Inge Iwan Folkesison, major, Linköping, f. 21/3/82 i Mjölby av öv:löj’tn. Folke E. o. Ingrid Eke-man. G. 14 m. Karin von Arnold. Barn: Gunnar f. 15, banktj :man, Lennart 17, lantmäst. — M’og:ex. i Linköp. 02, off:ex. 04, Gci 09-10, KHS 12-14. Undrlöjtn. v. Andra livgren :reg. 04, löjtn. 09, kapt. i reg. 19, v. reg. 22, avsk. s. major i armén 32. Tjg. v. Svea livg. 05-06 o. 06-07, reg:adjut. 15-17, komprchef 17-27, signaloff. 24-27, be-fälh. f. Linköp. ö. landsl :omr. 32-42. Rev. i Södermani. Ensk. Bank 31-45, granskn :man f. Södermani. i Skand. Banken sed. 46, rev. i A-B Hästsko-palatset i Sthlm sed. 32. RSO, RVO, Landst :SM.
translated: Egerström, Inge Iwan Folkesison, Major, Linköping, born 21/3/82 in Mjölby to Lieutenant Folke E. and Ingrid Ekeman. Married to Karin von Arnold in 1914. They have two children: Gunnar, born in 1915 and a bank clerk, and Lennart, born in 1917 and a surveyor. Inge graduated from Linköping College in 1902, the Military Academy in 1904, the General Staff College in 1909-1910, and the Royal War College in 1912-1914. He served as a second lieutenant in the Second Life Grenadier Regiment in 1904, lieutenant in 1909, captain in 1919, and lieutenant colonel in 1922. In 1932 he left the army as a major. He served in the Svea Life Guards in 1905-1906 and 1906-1907, was a regimental adjutant in 1915-1917, a company commander in 1917-1927, a signal officer in 1924-1927, and commander of the Linköping area and county in 1932-1942. He worked as a review inspector in Södermanland's private bank from 1931-1945, a verifier for Södermanland in Skandia Bank since 1946, and a reviewer for A-B Hästskopaltset in Stockholm from 1932. He was awarded RSO, RVO, and Landsting's SM.

award.name: Knight of the Order of Vasa
